concept.title: Query Language Considerations for the Native Client
concept.shortdesc: The query language supported in the GemFire native client is essentially a subset of OQL (ODMG 3.0 Object Data Management Group, www.odmg.org ), which is based on SQL-92. The query language provides the basic set of clauses, expressions, and operators used to retrieve elements from objects stored in cache regions.

conbody.p: The query language supported in the GemFire native client is essentially a subset of OQL (ODMG 3.0 Object Data Management Group, www.odmg.org ), which is based on SQL-92. The query language provides the basic set of clauses, expressions, and operators used to retrieve elements from objects stored in cache regions.
Query language features and grammar are described in detail in the Querying chapter of the GemFire User's Guide. The following section describes areas that are unique to the native client.
